#labels Phase-Deploy
#sidebar TableOfContent
Whether the library is or is not plugged into your favorite gedcom-application, you can allways use the library on a command line. 

=jar-folder=
The first step is create a folder and download some files into the folder:
  * The latest jar in the download section of this project
  * [https://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/src/main/resources/log4j.properties log4j.properties]
  * The jar files in the screenshot.<br> In practice you need jena-arq, jena-core, jena-iri, JavaAPIforKML, xml-apis, xercesImpl, jaxb-api, log4j, slf4j-api, slf4j-log4j.<br> You can search for the jars for example on http://mvnrepository.com/ Beware of advertisements with download buttons, carefully look for the download button on the artifact row.

=command line=

Below a partial command line example. The ovals in the diagram on the [overview] page represent such commands. Replace the dots (...) with the  files from the same diagram. 
{{{
java -Xmx1024M -cp jar-folder/* gedcom2sem.semweb.Select ...
}}}

_Note_: on windows the slash should be in the other direction.

_Hint_: on Windows you can put a desired command in a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Batch_file">.bat http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png</a> file, on Mac/Unix in a <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shell_script">.sh http://gedcom2sem.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/wiki-images/icon_external_link_blue.png</a> file for quick and easy execution._

The configuration files are self documenting and available in the source section of this project. Download the <em>raw files</em> from the [https://code.google.com/p/gedcom2sem/source/browse/trunk/src/main/resources/ resources], or extract the files from an unzipped version of the .jar file. Sample data files are available as [https://code.google.com/p/gedcom2sem/source/browse/#svn%2Ftrunk%2Fsrc%2Ftest%2Fresources test resources]
